pull.title: net: only delete CConnman if it's been created
pull.body:
This fixes a possible shutdown crash. Thanks to @morcos for reporting.

In the case of (for example) an already-running bitcoind, the shutdown sequence begins before CConnman has been created, leading to a null-pointer dereference when g_connman->Stop() is called.

events.body: Concept ACK, but wouldn't it be easier to invoke `CConnman::Stop()` from `CConnman::~CConnman`, and then call g_connman.reset() at the time you'd stop?
As discussed on IRC, yes. This is over-engineered as-is, for future threading scenarios that may not ever happen. I'll make that change.

events.message:
net: only delete CConnman if it's been created

In the case of (for example) an already-running bitcoind, the shutdown sequence
begins before CConnman has been created, leading to a null-pointer dereference
when g_connman->Stop() is called.

Instead, Just let the CConnman dtor take care of stopping.

issue.title: Backport Bitcoin PR#8715: net: only delete CConnman if it's been created
issue.body:
This is backport of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#8715.

The original PR description follows.
---
This fixes a possible shutdown crash. Thanks to @morcos for reporting.

In the case of (for example) an already-running bitcoind, the shutdown sequence begins before CConnman has been created, leading to a null-pointer dereference when g_connman->Stop() is called.

issue.title: Net cherries
issue.body:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8715 - net: only delete CConnman if it's been created
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9289 - net: drop boost::thread_group
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8688 - Move static global randomizer seeds into CConnman
  * Removed all "KeyedNetworkGroup" changes. We use a different node eviction scheme.
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8822 - net: Consistent checksum handling
  * Minor patching, the checksum creation was moved into FinalizeHeaders on our side.
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9045 - Hash P2P messages as they are received instead of at process-time
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9050 - net: make a few values immutable, and use deterministic randomness for the localnonce

git doesn't recognize that net_processing.cpp is renamed to main.cpp, so all changes in net_processing are manually applied

issue.title: [P2P] Begin Network Encapsulation
issue.body:
This is the finalization of the upstream PRs being tracked in #1374 to update much of our networking code to more closely follow upstream improvements. The following PRs are included here:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8466
  Do not shadow variables in networking code
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8606
  Fix some locks
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8085
  Begin encapsulation
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9289
  drop boost::thread_group
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8740
  No longer send local address in addrMe
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8661
  Do not set an addr time penalty when a peer advertises itself

Additionally, during conflict resolution and backporting of 8085, the following additional upstream PR was included:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8715
  only delete CConnman if it's been created


Still TODO in future PRs:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9037
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9441
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9609
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9626
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9708
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12381
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18584
